critique: This document focuses on transferring equal employment enforcement functions to the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) and making related technical amendments to existing executive orders. It emphasizes equal opportunity in federal employment and prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age. There is no discussion of immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or economic regulation. The document promotes social inclusion by strengthening equal employment opportunity.
